title: Nestled in a Wealthy Denver Suburb, This 1952 French Country-Style House Has a ‘Hollywood-Esque’ Interior
text:
Listing of the Day

Location: Cherry Hills Village, Colorado

Price: $7.75 million

This French Country-style house in the high-end Denver suburb of Cherry Hills Village has been completely rebuilt and reimagined as an expansive California-style resort.

The newly remodeled 1952 house’s interior is "more California, more Hollywood-esque," listing agent Marshall Emerson said.

"It’s a very unique house, especially for Denver, in its style and look," he said. "It’s also very well done."

The owner, a local developer and art collector who has a background in design, "is very meticulous and thoughtful about his design," Mr. Emerson said.

The "extensive remodel and expansion" took about 14 months and finished up about 18 months ago, he said.

More: An Art Collector’s Aspen Home Asks $16.9 Million

While gutting the house to the studs, the owner added a cabana wing with a 1,200-square-foot first-floor cabana and wet bar by the swimming pool and a luxurious 1,200-square-foot master suite above it.

The master bedroom looks west "so you see the mountains and it looks over the grounds as well," Mr. Emerson said.

The owner added a year-round greenhouse to create a courtyard around the pool and enlarged the kitchen to its current 800 square feet. He also converted the existing tennis court into a pickle-ball court for his children

Architectural and design features include custom doors and cabinetry, Icelandic marble, 24-karat gilded tiles, a La Cornue Chateau/Miele kitchen, LaCantina bi-fold windows, a slate roof and new mechanical systems.

The house has a lot of privacy, Mr. Emerson said. "It’s a corner lot and it’s bordered by an eclectic mix of hedges, bushes and trees. It’s also set back quite a bit."

"There are two entries, both gated—one in the front and one in the back, for service," he added.

More: Good Snow This Year in Aspen, Colorado, Drives Sales

Stats

The 10,510-square-foot house has five bedrooms, four full bathrooms and five partial bathrooms. It sits on a 2.21-acre lot.

Amenities

Amenities include five fireplaces, a 530-bottle wine cellar, a dedicated massage room, and an eight-car garage with a gardener’s entrance. There is also a pool, hot tub, a pickle-ball court, a formal garden, a working greenhouse and six outdoor fountains.

Neighborhood Notes

Cherry Hills Village is south of Denver but still very close to the city, Mr. Emerson said. It’s also one of the more central, upscale and oldest neighborhoods.

"It still has a country feel to it, but it is considered a suburb," he said. It’s about a 20-minute drive to downtown Denver.
